answers.answer: Hello Filli409,It seems that you undergo nerve conduction study to analyze the exact cause of the neuronopathic defects.There might be some nerve compression due to some secondary cause which need to be ruled out by MRI.Best

question: I do not have diabetes, but have the symptoms of neuropathy.  I've been tested but it was negative.  I've been taking Lyrica for 2 yrs., but have to keep increasing my dosage (200 mg./2x day).  My toes on left foot are becoming numb.  I've had a series of 3 shots of steroids, but that only caused skin deterioration.
title: Have burning, painful & very sensitive feet.
